      • filterByAttribute

        public static List<Entity> filterByAttribute(List<Entity> entities,
                             int attribute,
                             boolean value)
        Returns the subset of a given list of entities that have a specific attribute value.
        Parameters:
        entities - list of entities to filter
        attribute - attribute to filter by
        value - the value of the attribute
        Returns:
        a new list of entities that have attribute = value

      • filterByAttribute

        public static void filterByAttribute(List<Entity> entities,
                     int attribute,
                     boolean value,
                     List<Entity> target)
        Adds the subset of a given list of entities that have a specific attribute value to a target list.
        Parameters:
        entities - list of entities to filter
        attribute - attribute to filter by
        value - the value of the attribute
        target - the list to which filtered entities will be added

      • showPassages

        public static void showPassages(TextBundle b,
                String header,
                String moreLabel,
                String closeLabel,
                String... passageNames)
        Show a sequence of passages in via MetermanUI.showTextDialog(String, String, String).
        Parameters:
        b - text bundle to use
        header - header label
        moreLabel - the button label to show on all but the last passage
        closeLabel - the button label to show on the last passage
        passageNames - the bundle passages to show

      • showPassagesD

        public static void showPassagesD(TextBundle b,
                 String header,
                 String... passageNames)
        Like showPassages(com.illcode.meterman.TextBundle, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String...) but using default button labels. We called the method showPassagesD because the varargs makes it tricky to disambiguate overloaded methods with the same parameter types.

      • showPassagesF

        public static void showPassagesF(TextBundle b,
                 String... passageNames)
        Shows a sequence of "F" passages, that is, passages that specify their own header and button labels. Here is an example F-passage: 
        [ f-passage ]

          This is the header line
 And then the regular bunch of text that is
 going to be shown in the TextDialog.
      Button Label
        Note that the indentation doesn't matter, and is there only for visual clarity.
        • Header label: first line of the passage, whitespace trimmed.
        • Passage text: from the second through the second-to-last line.
        • Button label: last line of the passage, whitespace trimmed.
        Parameters:
        b - text bundle
        passageNames - bundle passages to show

      • ensureBundleHasParent

        public static void ensureBundleHasParent(TextBundle b,
                         TextBundle parentToEnsure)
        Ensures that somewhere up the parent chain, this bundle has a certain parent bundle.
        Parameters:
        b - text bundle
        parentToEnsure - the parent bundle we want to ensure is in the chain

      • defName

        public static String defName(Entity e,
             boolean capitalize)
        Return the name of the entity prefixed by the definite article ("the"), taking into account proper names.
        Parameters:
        e - entity
        capitalize - whether to capitalize the definite article

      • defName

        public static String defName(Entity e)
        Return the name of the entity prefixed by the definite article ("the") in lowercase.
        Parameters:
        e - entity

      • indefName

        public static String indefName(Entity e,
               boolean capitalize)
        Return the name of the entity prefixed by the indefinite article ("a/an/other"), taking into account proper names. If e.getIndefiniteArticle() returns null, we use "an" for names that begin with a vowel, and "a" otherwise.
        Parameters:
        e - entity
        capitalize - whether to capitalize the indefinite article

      • indefName

        public static String indefName(Entity e)
        Return the name of the entity prefixed by the indefinite article ("a/an/other") in lowercase.
        Parameters:
        e - entity

      • getCurrentTakeableEntities

        public static List<Entity> getCurrentTakeableEntities()
        Returns a list of all the Attributes.TAKEABLE entities in the current room and the player inventory. This is useful in situations, for instance, where some object has a slot that the player can put something into. The object has an action "Put in Slot" that, when activated, will prompt the player to choose what to put it -- and presumably only things that are TAKEABLE can be lifted and put in.

      • getCurrentTakeableEntities

        public static void getCurrentTakeableEntities(List<Entity> takeables)
        Like getCurrentTakeableEntities(), but uses a list given as a parameter to avoid allocation.

      • loadResources

        public static void loadResources(String json)
        Reads a JSON resource definition in this format: 
        {
     "sounds" : {
         "soundName1" : "sound-asset-path1",
         "soundName2" : "sound-asset-path2",
         ...
     },
     "music" : {
         "musicName1" : "music-asset-path1",
         "musicName2" : "music-asset-path2",
         ...
     },
     "images" : {
         "imageName1" : "image-asset-path1",
         "imageName2" : "image-asset-path2",
         ...
     }
 }
        and loads the listed sounds and images via SoundManager.loadSound(String, Path), SoundManager.loadMusic(String, Path), and MetermanUI.loadImage(String, Path), respectively.

        Normally, you would call this in Game.init(), if the resources are global, or Game.start(boolean), if the resources are specific to a particular map section or segment of the game.

        Parameters:
        json - JSON resource definition
